citations.narrative:
The licensee failed to handle an adult, female hyena in a manner that minimized risk of harm to the public. APHIS
obtained a local Sheriff Department report as well as a complaint from the public about an incident that occurred on
December 20, 2025. During today’s inspection, an APHIS official discussed the incident with the licensee who confirmed
it. The incident involved the licensee walking the hyena on a thin dog leash in a public area of the premises where it had
direct contact with members of the public. The licensee directed a member of the public to be photographed standing next
to the hyena. The hyena bit through the leash and escaped the licensee’s control and bit the guest in the calf causing a
severe wound that required hospitalization. Hyenas are powerful, wild predators that can cause serious injury when they
attack.
During public exhibitions, any animal must be handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the public,
with sufficient distance and/or barriers between the animal and the general viewing public so as to assure the safety of
animals and the public.
To be corrected from the date of this inspection on 12/31/2025 forward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.131(c)(1)  Critical
   
Handling of animals. 
The licensee failed to handle an adult, female hyena in a manner that minimized risk of harm to the public. APHIS 
obtained a local Sheriff Department report as well as a complaint from the public about an incident that occurred on 
December 20, 2025. During today’s inspection, an APHIS official discussed the incident with the licensee who confirmed 
it. The incident involved the licensee walking the hyena on a thin dog leash in a public area of the premises where it had 
direct contact with members of the public. The licensee directed a member of the public to be photographed standing next 
to the hyena. The hyena bit through the leash and escaped the licensee’s control and bit the guest in the calf causing a 
severe wound that required hospitalization. Hyenas are powerful, wild predators that can cause serious injury when they 
attack.  
During public exhibitions, any animal must be handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the public, 
with sufficient distance and/or barriers between the animal and the general viewing public so as to assure the safety of 
animals and the public. 
 
To be corrected from the date of this inspection on 12/31/2025 forward. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
